snippet.title: I have lots of migraines usually 2 days in a row and sometimes upto 5 days in a row how do I stop it
snippet.description: ... I usually have Aura and severe pain in my entire head most of the dull pain is in my sinus and my temples but it gets sharper on the top of my head all the way to the back of my head. I do have nausuea I am very sensative to light and sound I also almost hellucinate it feels like, even with sounds and light as well, I get them frequently then they dissapear foo a couple months and sometimes only weeks, I believe I have high blood pressure but Im not sure. I have allot of questions and cant afford to go to a doctor at all, are these migraines a disability? Its hard for employers to understand how bad these migraines are for me sometimes I cant even move... and go numb and lose feeling it seems. The migraines scare me and I need help and answers.. I have cut caffine and chocolate almost completely out of my diet I have tried 2 perscription drugs 1 being MAXALT which has done absolutely nothing for my migraine and SUMATRIPTAN which I think may be helping a l... ...

snippet.title: Fibromyalgia... living on Death Row
snippet.description: ... Hi... I'm Andie and I live with Fibromyalgia (among other things.). To me it can feel like living on death row. You sit there in pain that can be so severe as to leaving you literaly weeping on the floor, yet you can't die from it. You might even want to, but it won't give you that release. I'm sure most living with chronic pain can relate. I'd love to hear from you! ...

snippet.title: I wanted to know if genital warts grow in tiny rows as well as clusters?
snippet.description: ... I`m always giving myself vaginal exams, especially being sexually active. ... & Recently on the inside lining of my vagina I've noticed a row of tiny little pink bumps. So of course I'm panicing and heading to a doc asap... but I`m trying to find an ob/gyn instead of a regular doctor. ...

snippet.title: AFA Care Connection: Meredeth Rowe Speaks Tonight
snippet.description: ... Hello friends, ... Please join us this Thursday evening on Care Connection for an informative live discussion with Dr. Jamie. You and other caregivers can participate in this informative and interactive discussion for support and inspiration. ... ... Please join us! ... ... Topic: Nighttime Activity and Caregiver Coping ... ... Guest speaker Meredeth A Rowe ... Thursday, August 7, 2008 at 9 pm Eastern Time ... Call toll free 1 (877) AFA - 2992 ... When prompted to do so enter the guest identification number 2 7 1 0 0 4 # ... Care Connection is a FREE telephone support network service for caregivers of individuals with Alzheimer's disease and related illnesses jointly sponsored by the Alzheimer's Foundation of America and Ask Dr. Jamie. Every Thursday, the telephone support network offers caregivers support, education and connection to other caregivers and professionals. Special guest speakers and experts provide interesting and practical topics each month. Caregivers from anywhere in the ... ...

snippet.title: I recently suffered aura migranes for 6 days in a row!
snippet.description: ... I have aura migranes speradically throught my life. I recently had an episode last me 6 days in a row, with new symptoms, EXTREME fatigue, sharp pain and pressure in LEFT temple/ear area, and weakness in my right arm. when ever i sat up or bent over i felt immense pressure in my head that was so intense that I was laying in bed whenever i could get away with it... and I am a 21 year old mother of a 1 1/2 year old, sp this hasnt been an easy recovery. I am asking this in hopes to gain insight. I am uninsured and I dont want to walk into an expensive appointment not knowing if i am getting proper care, or if they are running the right tests ( if any at all) ... the only time that i say a dr about my migranes was at age 14, and I was suffering since age 9. he gave me immitrex and said that some people just get them. and whell that was ok for a long time, but that answer is no longer acceptable, and i want and deserve more. becasue this is suffering and I need to get peace... ...

snippet.title: Experiencing occasional irregular heartbeats, most recently got two or three of them in a row.
snippet.description: ... ... Tonight I was just watching TV and suddenly got two or three abnormal beats like this in a row and it gave me a terrible feeling like my heart was seizing up or something. It was alarming enough that it got my heart racing and made me feel lightheaded for awhile until I was able to calm down. My family has a history of heart problems but I'm only 23 and haven't had any other health issues that I'm aware of. ... ... I do drink a lot of coffee and have anxiety at times, but I don't know if that has anything to do with it. I have no doctor at the moment and haven't seen one for many years. Should I be very concerned about these irregular heart beats? ... ... ... On a side no... ...

snippet.title: How many days in a row can I safely take Imitrex?
snippet.description: ... Full Question: ... How many days in a row can I safely take Imitrex. I take Imitrex 100 mg tabs. I'm trying to break up rebound migraines after taking Fioricet with codeine. Also, how many days to I need to be off painkillers (mainly Fioricet) to stop this rebound cycle? Can I take plain Tylenol or Excedrin while I'm stopping the Fioricet and then try to wean off of those? Imitrex and other triptan's side effects temporarily make symptoms worse for about 1-2 hours so I try to avoid it, but they always do cure the migraine. If necessary I will take imitrex. I know the dangers of pain killers/NSAIDS, but I'm not sure about Imitrex. I worry about my liver and kidneys with all the Tylenol. I also take Zoloft 400 mg HS, Cymbalta 60 mg in morn, Neurontin 1200 mg, Lamictal 200 BID, Prazosin (for PTSD nightmares) 2mg HS and Seroquel. A couple wks ago I received an injection of Lupron for endometriosis and started Progesterone tabs 5mg in a.m. I will... ...
